qas.question: What is the name of New York City's climate using the Köppen climate classification?
How many sunny days does New York average each year?
How many hours of sunshine does New York receive every year?
The suburbs of the city lie between the humid subtropical and what other climate zone?
What month in New York City is the coldest?
What type of climate does NYC possess?
How many days on average does NYC get sunshine annually?
What planting zone does the city land in?

context: Under the Köppen climate classification, using the 0 °C (32 °F) coldest month (<a4_0>January<a4_0/>) isotherm, New York City itself experiences a <a0_0><a5_0>humid subtropical<a5_0/><a0_0/> climate (Cfa) and is thus the northernmost major city on the North American continent with this categorization. The suburbs to the immediate north and west lie in the transition zone from a humid subtropical (Cfa) to a <a3_0>humid continental<a3_0/> climate (Dfa). The area averages <a1_0><a6_0>234<a6_0/><a1_0/> days with at least some sunshine annually, and averages 57% of possible sunshine annually, accumulating <a2_0>2,535<a2_0/> hours of sunshine per annum. The city falls under <a7_0>USDA 7b<a7_0/> Plant Hardiness zone.
